content:
I just opened 3 PR on finite groups and permutation groups:

  • #21186 : subgroups of index 2 are normal, subgroups of index the smallest prime factor are normal
  • #21188 : the alternating group is a characteristic subgroup
  • #21190 : the alternating group is the only subgroup of the permutation group of index 2

They are relatively elementary.

Allow me to recall the more difficult PR which have been open for a long time

  • #17522 : computes the centralizer of a permutation, in particular its cardinality and the cardinality of conjugacy classes
  • #19456 : analogue in the alternating group
  • #12052 : primitive actions
  • #12053 : some theorems for primitive actions on finite sets
  • #12048 : the Iwasawa criterion for simplicity.
@Antoine Chambert-Loir, I see #17522 has many unresolved conversations. Could you mark them all as resolved if that is the case?
Also, I can't find the downstream import report on that PR (and so can't evaluate the large-import label). Perhaps it needs a merge of master?
I just closed the two (is that “many”?) conversations that had remained open (as a matter of fact, I had waited for an answer by Johan, but OK), and just merged master.
Thanks. The import increase looks reasonably to me.
It looks like from all the PRs you mentioned, only #21186 can currently be reviewed. #12052, #17522 and #19456 are waiting on you to fix them, and the other ones are blocked by other PRs
For the sake of the emoji reactions, I will post the PRs that are currently open from the above list, one per message.
• #21186 : subgroups of index 2 are normal, subgroups of index the smallest prime factor are normal
• #21190 : the alternating group is the only subgroup of the permutation group of index 2
• #17522 : computes the centralizer of a permutation, in particular its cardinality and the cardinality of conjugacy classes
• #12053 : some theorems for primitive actions on finite sets
